activities:
We are engaged by our Clients to conduct research surveys.
The purpose of surveys we conduct is not to sell or promote anything. Survey research is a legitimate and scientific process of acquiring data and opinions from the public. Researchers seek to determine the public's opinion regarding products, issues, candidates, and other topics. Such information is used to develop new products, improve services, influence policy, and is used by health care providers, the government, airlines, private businesses and others. We also conduct employee assessments and feedback programs. As researchers, we are respectful of participants' right to privacy or non-participation. Data that is collected is held strictly confidential and is used for statistical purposes.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Personal information, including client human resources data, may be transferred to us by our clients or collected in the conduct of a survey.  While not typically manually processed, there are some situations where client requirements may dictate manual processing.
privacyprograms: Commonwealth of Massachusetts, Office of Consumer Affairs and Business Regulation: 201 CMR 17 Compliance
